Articles.Content:
Hello

I updated today to beta than ever.

Every time I try to enter the VAB the game collapses.

I have installed KSO and FASA modes.

Shall I delete the modes or there is another solution?

I had the same problem. During the load from Steam I got messages saying I had installed mods that conflicted with the beta update. I didn't catch all the problems, but it listed MechJeb, Kethane, and Biomes as conflicts.

I had a saved 'clean' version, so I can still play that, but I've got a fair amount of work into my modded game, including a fully built 'Station Science' space station, and more than half way up the tech tree on career mode.

Does anyone know how to...

1. Unload the beta from my modded version, or...

2. Load the beta on my 'clean' version (I tried getting Steam to redownload but am not having a lot of success).

Thanks.

Please follow the instructions in the "How to get support" sticky thread in this forum. Chances are there is some problem with one or both of the mods that is causing the problem but without more information, removing them is the only advice that can be given...

Thanks...

It might be helpful if there were a list of the mods that 0.90 is or is not compatible with. That way we could figure out whether it's a good idea to load it over our existing game. Can anyone out there help out with this?

KSP: 0.90 Windows7 64bit

Problem: Game collapses every time when I enter the VAB

Mods installed:

FASA, KSO, ISA MapSat

Reproduction steps:

Game collapses every time when I enter the VAB

Log:

No log, simply collapses.

I have the same issue with game collapse by entering VAB. It also happened once at Mission Control, although I seemed to get farther in Mission Control than anywhere else - actually was able to fly some of the craft I have around the system...

I have the following mods: DMMagic Orbital Science, KASA, KOSMOS, KWRocketry, NearFutureElectrical, RN_Salyut, RN_Soyuz, and WarpPlugin. Everything was working fine until the Beta download. I have some extreme builds using parts from these mods, so it would be a serious chore to try and surgically remove parts from the various builds from the various mods.

HELP!!!! (I do have a crash folder that popped up in KSP directory, but do not understand enough about what's in it to use it in any constructive troubleshooting)

Edited December 16, 2014 by jagrafess

My advice: Don't use mods not for the version you have (like 0.25 for 0.90)

Wait for them to update

Thanks...

It might be helpful if there were a list of the mods that 0.90 is or is not compatible with. That way we could figure out whether it's a good idea to load it over our existing game. Can anyone out there help out with this?

There's been one in the General Add-on Affairs forum for the past few updates:

The Official Mod Compatibility Thread
